Show HN: A modified macOS ls that supports –group-directories-first
text:
I finally got tired of not having directories first on macOS, and - for me - something like exa <https://the.exa.website/> was overkill. So I dug into the source code, hunted down the missing BSD-licensed headers, figured out how to work around the APSL headers, and smoothed out the rough edges.

Very much a personal itch-scratching exercise and only a couple hours worth of work, but maybe it'll be useful for someone else.

Tell HN: Root Available for Vacuum+Mop Robots
text:
Dear HN,

I believe this year I found the easiest way ever to impress my family with my technical skills... by rooting a Dreame W10 cleaning robot :)

We always had dismissed buying one due to the obvious privacy concerns of connecting an always-online device with camera and microphone to the Xiaomi cloud. But this year, they're available for cheap (I got mine at 70% off MSRP) and the hardware has glowing reviews and there's now Dustbuilder support [1].

The rooting process was exceptionally simple. Next to the dustbin, there's an UART port to which you connect one of those $5 USB to UART converters (3.3V model). I've painted the pinout I used in [2].

$ sudo screen /dev/ttyUSB0 115200,ixoff

Press the reset button... and you have a root login prompt. Calculate your password according to [3] and you can now do backups of the nand with dd+curl and install a patched firmware like [4] to add an SSH server.

By now, it should work with MQTT and 3rd-party miio apps without any internet connection. As a last step, you can install the excellent Valetudo open source web-GUI [5] which, BTW, is React+NodeJS so easy to customize to your liking.

And now, everyone in the house can remote-control the vacuum robot just by opening a website :)

The Dreame W10 that I use also supports multiple floors through miio commands, so I patched my Valetudo installation to support that. Just never ever mention multiple floors to the Valetudo team, because they have a very strict policy that everyone who doesn't own a single-floor penthouse apartment must be an idiot ^_^

But overall, the rooting process was easy, didn't require any disassembly of the robot, didn't require any obscure tools and now I can ssh into root on the robot and it doesn't have any internet connection and works just fine. Also integrates with Home Assistant, if you fancy that.

Happy Christmas hacking, everyone!

[1] https://dontvacuum.me/robotinfo/detail_dreame.vacuum.p2027_0.html

[2] https://ibb.co/TwfdMxT

[3] https://builder.dontvacuum.me/dreamepassword.php

[4] https://builder.dontvacuum.me/_dreame_p2027.html

[5] https://valetudo.cloud/

title: Stress
text: Stress is a normal response to our busy lives and it can be difficult for many people. However, when we don't deal with stress it can lead to serious consequences and must be dealt with. So we need to look for ways to deal with stress.

Ask HN: Implement a setup wizard in a microservice architecture environement
text:
I would like to implement a initial setup wizard for an application based on a microservice architecture. Should the frontend check whether the application is already initialized (via a dedicated endpoint) or return 50x error code until the setup process has been completed.

Or should I just load sample data and let the admin do the initial setup work?
